meanings.definition: To change the arrangement or formation of something.
meanings.sent1: She is reconfiguring her room to make space for a new desk.
meanings.sent2: The IT team is reconfiguring the network for better efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces were reconfiguring themselves when no one was looking!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a constantly reconfiguring maze, always finding new paths.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands moved swiftly, reconfiguring the clay into a beautiful sculpture.

meanings.definition: To adjust or alter the structure or layout of something.
meanings.sent1: He is reconfiguring the settings on his phone to save battery.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer is reconfiguring the furniture placement in the living room.
meanings.sent3: The robot kept reconfiguring its movements, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline was reconfiguring itself as the sun set behind the buildings.
meanings.sent5: The chef was reconfiguring the recipe, adding a new twist to the dish.
